Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I've read this (outdated) description of science points

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62657-Understanding-Science-Points

and the description of the Scientist

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Scientist

but neither explains what is meant by the description beside Bob Kerbal at the start of the game "Science Part Return: 100%".

Does that mean Bob gives a bonus of doubling (i.e. +100%) of the science return from science experiments? Or is this redundant (100% being no change) or will it increase with experience?

It is the multiplier. So if science part gives 20 points and his bonus is 100%, you will get 20 points. When Bob (or any scientist) is level 1, this value is 100% ... but each level, this value increases so it does help quite a bit in the long run to use scientists and level them up.
awesome, that's what I'd hoped. It would be good if the wiki had this documented, if somebody knows the rules and career progression there's an ideal opportunity to update the docs here :-)
I have never seen it work like this. The only thing I have seen is science jrs and goo pods return about 20% more science first time and less science the second time.

^ The Science value will decrease for repeated experiments.

If, however, you were to run a test by recovering a ship with a goo unit and a Level 1 Scientist, and then revert the mission and redo it with a Level 2 Scientist, you'd see an increase in the Science gained relative to the other mission. Presumably, repeated experiments will also include a bonus, although it will naturally shrink as the Science value decays.
